item.title: Third time I’ve reported the potholes along Hayden Road in Cheltenham, 23rd February
item.description:
This is the third time I’ve reported these potholes. I keep getting emails to say they have been fixed but they haven’t. Hayden road is extremely bad for driving along. There are multiple potholes, some are really deep and some are extremely wide, hard to navigate your way thorough. They are in the lane and in the middle of the road along the white line so there is no way of avoiding them. People, including myself, I have also seen 4x4s swerve to avoid them so you can only imagine how bad they are. Someone is either going to have damage caused to their tyres or there is going to be an accident from where people have to swerve. The speed limit along the road is 40mph but to drive down that road safely, people are having to drive less than 10mph. These potholes NEED fixing before someone’s dies or someone has to pay an extortionate amount to get their car fixed. I thought Gloucestershire was green for fixing potholes? Stop lying saying you’ve filled them in when they haven’t even been touched
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous holes appearing, 23rd February
item.description:
This is an ongoing issue and the area around it is becoming waterlogged, slippery and all grass has been dug up. Holes are appearing on a regular basis. It’s an unsightly mess on what was a lovely green area.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Lyndhurst Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Direction sign moving with the wind direction, 23rd February
item.description:
In front of The Old Police Station on the corner of North St. and Greet Rd., Winchcombe. The GWR Winchcombe Station sign at the top of the post points in whatever direction the wind blows. The top section of the post appears to be loose. The photo shows approx. 180 degs out. The post is in a very poor condition and may probably eventually fail ,with potential H&S implications.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, North Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet
